content:
Toya Bungkah is a village located on the shores of Lake Batur, which is the starting point for the most popular hiking trail to the summit of Mount Batur in Bali. Here are some ways to reach Toya Bungkah:

1. Private car or taxi - The most convenient way to reach Toya Bungkah is by hiring a private car or taxi. This will give you the flexibility to stop along the way and explore other attractions if you wish. You can easily arrange a car or taxi through your hotel or a local tour operator.
2. Scooter rental - If you're comfortable riding a scooter, you can rent one and drive to Toya Bungkah on your own. There are several scooter rental shops in the area, and the roads are generally well-maintained.
3. Shuttle bus - Many tour operators offer shuttle buses that run from popular tourist areas in Bali, such as Ubud, Kuta, and Seminyak, to Toya Bungkah. This is a more affordable option than hiring a private car, but it may be less flexible in terms of timing and stops.
4. Public transportation - It's possible to reach Toya Bungkah by public transportation, but this can be more challenging and time-consuming. You would need to take a bus from Denpasar or Ubud to Kintamani, and then transfer to a local minibus or bemo to Toya Bungkah.
